stem_html: What is the mathematical relationship linking the energy of a photon to its frequency?

answers.content_html: Molecules with the formulas \text{CH}_3\text{CH}_2\text{OH} and \text{C}_3\text{H}_6\text{O}_2 could be structural isomers.
answers.feedback_html: \text{CH}_3\text{CH}_2\text{OH} is an alcohol while \text{C}_3\text{H}_6\text{O}_2 is a carboxylic acid. Because they are different molecules with different numbers of atoms, they cannot be structural isomers.

answers.content_html: Molecules must have a single bond to be cis-trans isomers.
answers.feedback_html: Cis-trans isomers do not rotate around single bonds

answers.content_html: To be enantiomers, a molecule must have at least three different atoms or groups connected to a central carbon
answers.feedback_html: Recall enantiomers have just three different atoms connected to central carbon atom, not more than that

answers.content_html: To be enantiomers, a molecule must have at least four different atoms or groups connected to a central carbon
answers.feedback_html: To be an enantiomer, a molecule must have at least four different atoms attached to the central carbon atom

stem_html: Which of the following statements is true?

answers.content_html: The presence of limestone would not make a difference.
answers.feedback_html: Calcium carbonate acts as a buffer that minimizes pH changes

answers.content_html: An environment rich in limestone would be more affected by acid rain.
answers.feedback_html: Calcium carbonate acts as a buffer that minimizes pH changes.

answers.content_html: An environment poor in limestone would be more affected by acid rain.
answers.feedback_html: Calcium carbonate acts as a buffer that minimizes pH changes, so an area poor in limestone would be more affected by acid rain than an area rich in limestone.

answers.content_html: The impact would depend on the type of vegetation present.
answers.feedback_html: Some vegetation may be more sensitive to acid rain than others, but all vegetation would benefit from calcium carbonate buffering.

stem_html: Limestone is a naturally occurring mineral rich in calcium carbonate (\text{CaCO}_3). In water, calcium carbonate dissolves to form carbonate ({{\text{CO}_3}{\!}}^{2-}), a weak base that acts as a buffer. Which would you expect to be more affected by acid rain, an environment rich in limestone or an environment poor in limestone?

answers.content_html: The mass number and atomic number of carbon-13 is 13 and 6, while that of carbon-12 is 12 and 6, respectively.
answers.feedback_html: The mass number and atomic number of carbon-13 is 13 and 6, respectively. While, that of carbon-12 is 12 and 6, respectively.

answers.content_html: The mass number and atomic number of carbon-13 is 13 and 12, while that of carbon-12 is 12 and 6, respectively.
answers.feedback_html: The atomic number of carbon-13 is not 12.

answers.content_html: The mass number and atomic number of carbon-13 is 13 and 13, while that of carbon-12 is 12 and 6, respectively.
answers.feedback_html: The mass number and atomic number of carbon-13 are not the same for this isotope of carbon.

answers.content_html: The mass number and atomic number of carbon-13 is 13 and 12, while that of carbon-12 is 12 and 12, respectively.
answers.feedback_html: The atomic number of carbon, and all of its isotopes, is not 12.

stem_html: List the mass number and atomic number of carbon-12 and carbon-13, respectively.
